pedestrian:
<Pedestrian>
Description: A single person walking on foot viewed from above. Appears as a slender upright figure with a small head–shoulder blob; often near sidewalks, crossings, or plaza edges; not connected to any vehicle. Common confusions: people (crowd), bicycle/motor riders.
people:
<People>
Description: A group or one person not clearly walking (standing, sitting, or crowd). Seen as irregular clusters of small human shapes; individuals may be hard to separate. Not mounted on vehicles. Common confusions: pedestrian (single walker), riders on bicycles/motorcycles.
bicycle:
<Bicycle>
Description: Two‑wheel human‑powered vehicle. From a drone view it looks like a thin elongated frame with two circular wheels; usually with a rider leaning forward; slower than motor. Common confusions: motor (scooter/motorcycle).
car:
<Car>
Description: Standard passenger vehicle with four wheels and a closed body. Top‑down shape is a compact rectangle with visible roof/windshield; smaller than van, much smaller than bus or truck. Common confusions: van (taller/boxier), taxi (still a car).
van:
<Van>
Description: Mid‑size, box‑shaped vehicle with a higher roof than a car. Rectangular footprint with blunt nose; longer and taller than cars but shorter than trucks; often used for delivery or people moving. Common confusions: car (lower profile), small truck.
truck:
<Truck>
Description: Large cargo vehicle. From above it has a long rectangular body and often a separate cab; cargo bed/box is prominent; occupies multiple lane widths in length. Common confusions: bus (many windows, passenger doors), large van.
tricycle:
<Tricycle>
Description: Three‑wheeled vehicle without a canopy. Narrow front or rear single wheel with two wheels on the other axle; small cargo bed or open seat visible from above. Common confusions: awning‑tricycle (has roof), motor (two wheels).
awning-tricycle:
<Awning Tricycle>
Description: Three‑wheeled vehicle with a visible canopy/roof (motor‑rickshaw/tuk‑tuk style). Top‑down cue is a small covered cabin with three wheels and open sides. Common confusions: tricycle (no canopy), very small van.
bus:
<Bus>
Description: Long passenger vehicle with many side windows. From above it forms an elongated rectangle significantly longer than cars; doors near the middle or front; often on main roads or at stations. Common confusions: long truck (cargo box, fewer windows).
motor:
<Motorcycle/Scooter>
Description: Two‑wheel motorized vehicle (motorbike or scooter). Very thin elongated shape; rider usually visible; faster than bicycles and often near lane edges. Common confusions: bicycle (no engine bulk, thinner wheels).
